reference.shortdesc: The glossSurfaceForm element specifies an unambiguous presentation of the glossterm that might combine multiple forms. The surface form is suitable to introduce the term in new contexts.

section.p: The glossSurfaceForm element is most often used for terms that also specify the glossAcronym element. In that context, the glossSurfaceForm element contains the term in a manner that introduces both the term and the acronym, so that later references to the term can be replaced with the acronym alone. See the abbreviated-form element for a full description of how the surface form is used together with acronyms.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following topic defines the term "Anti-lock Braking System". Within the topic, the glossSurfaceForm element provides a version of the term that combines both the primary term and the acronym. This allows references to the topic from abbreviated-form to different versions of the term in different contexts.
